Age.Description: There should have been a description here, but there wasn't. :(

IQverbal.Description: Verbal IQ was assessed by means of the Acentuación de Palabras test. The equivalent verbal IQ for 24.2 is 104 (39).

LSHS_14.Description: Proneness to hallucinations in healthy participants

LSHSvoice_items4910.LongName: Items 4, 9, and 10 of the LSHS scale
LSHSvoice_items4910.Description: Items 4, 9, and 10 of the LSHS scale, related to verbal hallucinations

LSHSaudit_items57.LongName: Items 5 and 7 of the LSHS scale
LSHSaudit_items57.Description: Items 5 and 7 of the LSHS scale, related to auditory hallucinations

VisualScore.Description: The subjects were asked to self-rate the truth of the following statements using a 0-3 scale, 0 being the least true: 'I can easily identify animals or things in the clouds', 'When I see spots (of painting, humidity...), I can see faces, silhouettes or objects in them.' The sum of these two scores constitutes the VisualScore
VisualScore.Units: 0-6, 0 being lowest proneness to visual imagery

VisScore_high.LongName: Participants with high visual imagery score
VisScore_high.Description: Participants scoring at least 2 at one or both of the items

DELUproneness.Description: Proneness to delusions was assessed by means of the Peters Delusion Inventory scale

TRhit.Description: Average response time for hit trials

TRomission.Description: Average response time for omission trials

TRfalseAlarm.Description: Average response time for false alarm trials

TRcorrectRej.Description: Average response time for correct rejection trials

TRmean.Description: Average response time across all trials

Pr.Description: Ability to discriminate presented pictures from presented words

Br.Description: Tendency to remember presented words as presented pictures
